PWI 2024 Terms and Conditions & Privacy Policy

Use, Collection, and Retention of Client Information

We respect the privacy of our clients and understand the importance of keeping their personal information secure. We collect, retain, and use only the information that is necessary to administer our business and provide our clients with high-quality services. We retain this information no longer than necessary to meet these objectives. All transmitted credit card information is handled securely through digitally encrypted Secure Socket Layers (SSL) technology.

We take the security of your credit card information seriously and handle all transmitted credit card information securely through digitally encrypted Secure Socket Layers (SSL) technology. This ensures that your credit card information is protected from unauthorized access, disclosure, or alteration.

We will retain your personal information for only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law. We will take reasonable steps to ensure that your personal information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.

By using our services, you agree to the terms and conditions set forth in this document.

Personal Data

During your use of our Service e, we may ask You to provide Us with certain personally identifiable information that will allow us to contact or identify you. This identifiable information may include but is not limited to:

Email address

First name and last name

Address, City, State, Province, and ZIP/Postal Code

Usage Data

We may also collect other information that is necessary to provide you with our service, including information about your device, IP address, and browsing history.

We will only use your personally identifiable information for the purposes for which it was collected, and we will not disclose or share it with third parties unless required by law or necessary to provide our service to you. We take the privacy and security of your personal information seriously and will take reasonable measures to protect it from unauthorized access or disclosure.

By using our service, you consent to the collection and use of your personally identifiable information as described in this document.

Usage Data

We automatically collect Usage Data when you use our service. This may include information such as your device's Internet Protocol (IP) address, browser type, and version, the pages of our service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, and other diagnostic data. We may also collect other information necessary to provide our service to you, such as unique device identifiers.

If you access our service through a mobile device, we may collect additional information, such as the type of mobile device you use, your mobile device's unique ID, the IP address of your mobile device, your mobile operating system, and the type of mobile internet browser you use.

We may also collect information that Your browser sends whenever You visit our service or access our service through a mobile device.

By using our service, you consent to the collection and use of Usage Data as described in this document.

Removing Personal Data

An individual has the right to erasure, also known as 'the right to be forgotten'. The principle underpinning this right is to enable an individual to request the deletion or removal of personal data where there is no compelling reason for its continued processing. To request deletion of your data, please email nonprofit@projectworldimpact.com.

Information from Third-Party Social Media Services

Project World Impact allows You to create an account and log in to use the Service through the following third-party social media services, such as Google, Facebook, and Twitter. If you choose to register or log in through a third-party social media service, we may collect personal data that is already associated with your third-party social media account, such as your name, email address, activities, or contact list associated with that account.

If You decide to register through or otherwise grant us access to a Third-Party Social Media Service, We may collect Personal data that is already associated with Your Third-Party Social Media Service's account, such as Your name, Your email address, Your activities or Your contact list associated with that account.

You may also have the option to share additional information with Project World Impact through Your third-party social media account. If You choose to provide this information and personal data during registration or otherwise, You are giving Project World Impact permission to use, share, and store it in a manner consistent with this Privacy Policy.

If you have an account with us and no longer wish to use our service, you may delete your account by contacting us at nonprofit@projectworldimpact.com. If you would like to exercise your right to erasure (also known as 'the right to be forgotten'), you may also request that we delete or remove your personal data from our systems. Please note that we may not be able to delete your personal data in all circumstances, such as when we have a legal obligation to retain it or when it is necessary to provide our service to you.

By using our service and registering through a third-party social media service, you consent to the collection, use, and sharing of your personal data as described in this document.

Spam Policy

We do not condone the use of spam or the sending of unsolicited emails in any form. Spamming is the practice of flooding the internet with many copies of the same message, often targeting individual users with direct mail messages. The costs of email spam are generally paid for by the recipient or carriers, rather than the sender. We have no control over other websites' involvement or practices in this area.

By using our service, you agree not to engage in spamming or any other form of unsolicited communication. If we find that a user has violated this policy, we reserve the right to terminate their account and take any other appropriate action.

If you receive an unsolicited email that appears to be from our service or our domain, please do not respond or click on any links contained within the message. Instead, please forward the message to us at nonprofit@projectworldimpact.com so that we can investigate.
